citations.narrative:
The registrant has been conducting regulated activities without a valid USDA license. Over the past 2 years, 25 common
marmosets and 3 red ruffed lemurs have been sold that were born and raised on the premises. The registrant believed
that it was ok to sell the nonhuman primates due to approval of the registration application. There was confusion
regarding being licensed verses having a registration. Failure to obtain the required license with USDA prevents APHIS
officials from determining compliance with the Animal Welfare Act and ensuring humane treatment of covered animals. No
person shall operate as a dealer, exhibitor, or operator of an auction sale, without a valid license, except persons who are
exempt from the licensing requirements under paragraph (a)(3) of section 2.1.
No regulated activities may be conducted until a USDA license is obtained.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the registrant.

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
The registrant has been conducting regulated activities without a valid USDA license. Over the past 2 years, 25 common 
marmosets and 3 red ruffed lemurs have been sold that were born and raised on the premises. The registrant believed 
that it was ok to sell the nonhuman primates due to approval of the registration application. There was confusion 
regarding being licensed verses having a registration. Failure to obtain the required license with USDA prevents APHIS 
officials from determining compliance with the Animal Welfare Act and ensuring humane treatment of covered animals. No 
person shall operate as a dealer, exhibitor, or operator of an auction sale, without a valid license, except persons who are 
exempt from the licensing requirements under paragraph (a)(3) of section 2.1. 
 
No regulated activities may be conducted until a USDA license is obtained. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the registrant.
